# epilot-validation-rule_validation_rule (Resource)

ValidationRule Resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "epilot-validation-rule_validation_rule" "my_validationrule" {
  placeholder = "...my_placeholder..."
  rule = {
    numeric_rule_type = {
      conditions = {
        one = {
          all = [
            {
              numeric_nested_condition = {
                two = {
                  any = [
                    {
                      one = {
                        fact     = "total-length"
                        operator = "greaterThanInclusive"
                        params = {
                          error_message = "...my_error_message..."
                        }
                        value = 0.43
                      }
                      three = {
                        fact     = "decimal-digits-count"
                        operator = "equal"
                        params = {
                          error_message = "...my_error_message..."
                        }
                        value = 7.92
                      }
                    }
                  ]
                }
              }
            }
          ]
        }
      }
      type = "numeric"
    }
  }
  title = "...my_title..."
}
```

## Schema

### Required

- `rule` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule))
- `title` (String) Title of the validation rule.

### Optional

- `placeholder` (String) Placeholder for the validation rule.

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (String) ISO timestamp when the rule was created.
- `created_by` (String) User ID of the creator.
- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the validation rule.
- `organization_id` (String) Organization ID that owns this rule.
- `schema_version` (String) Schema version of the validation rule.
- `updated_at` (String) ISO timestamp when the rule was last updated.
- `updated_by` (String) User ID of the last updater.

Optional:

- `numeric_rule_type` (Attributes) Validation rule for numeric values, supporting range and digit count constraints. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule--numeric_rule_type))
- `pattern_rule_type` (Attributes) Validation rule that uses a sequence of patterns to validate input. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule--pattern_rule_type))
- `regex_rule_type` (Attributes) Validation rule that uses a regular expression to validate input. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule--regex_rule_type))

### Nested Schema for `rule.numeric_rule_type.conditions.one.all.numeric_fact_condition.four`

Optional:

- `fact` (String) Whether the input has leading zeros. Not Null; must be "has-leading-zeroes"
- `operator` (String) Leading zeros check operator. Not Null; must be one of ["equal", "notAllowed"]
- `params` (Attributes) Additional parameters for the condition (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule--numeric_rule_type--conditions--one--all--numeric_fact_condition--four--params))
- `value` (Boolean) Whether leading zeros should be present or not. Not Null

- `value` (Number) Expected number of integer digits. Not Null

<a id="nestedatt--rule--regex_rule_type"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rule.regex_rule_type`

Optional:

- `conditions` (Attributes) Condition definition for a regex-based validation rule (2 levels deep). Not Null (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule--regex_rule_type--conditions))
- `type` (String) Indicates this is a regex-based validation rule. Not Null; must be "regex"

<a id="nestedatt--rule--regex_rule_type--conditions"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rule.regex_rule_type.conditions`

Optional:

- `one` (Attributes) All conditions must be true (AND logic) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule--regex_rule_type--conditions--one))
- `three` (Attributes) NOT condition (negation) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule--regex_rule_type--conditions--three))
- `two` (Attributes) Any conditions must be true (OR logic) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule--regex_rule_type--conditions--two))

### Nested Schema for `rule.regex_rule_type.conditions.one.all.regex_fact_condition`

- `params` (Attributes) Additional parameters for the condition (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--rule--regex_rule_type--conditions--two--any--regex_nested_condition--three--not--params))
- `value` (String) The actual regex. Not Null

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

In Terraform v1.5.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `id` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = epilot-validation-rule_validation_rule.my_epilot-validation-rule_validation_rule
  id = "..."
}
```

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import epilot-validation-rule_validation_rule.my_epilot-validation-rule_validation_rule "..."
```
